page.title: 04RAGLAN CHURCH
page.content: { RAGLAN CHURCH} Raglan church was built in about 1500. It is owned by the Church in Wales.It is an historically listed building and the preaching cross in the churchyard is a listed monument. Inside the church are the remains of the effigies of the Earls of Worcester broken in Cromwells time.There is a stained glass window in memory of the 1st Lord Raglan of the Crimea.The Union Jack is flown on Commonwealth Days and the Queens birthday.The Church of Wales flag is flown on main festival days and Saints Days. The church bell is rung by the verger. There is also a set of electronic bells used for weddings.On three sides of the tower there is a clock face given by Mrs. Bosanquet.She had quarrelled with the Station master so the side facing the station road has no clock face.
